utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Could you tell me what brought you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure um so my my son. He's 2 1/2 months old an were we're in the ER because he's had this cough, fever an seems like he's breathing too fast. It's been happening for the past two days and we weren't sure what else to do for him.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, so the first thing here would be, uh, like vital signs and assessing kind of stability. So is there, do we have this information?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We're going to say vitals stable. He is on 2 litres of oxygen right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So when did the symptoms specifically start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Two days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what started first?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um so. I guess he was coughing first and then we took his temperature and it seemed like he had a fever. It was over 38 and then over the past couple of hours it seems like he's having a hard time breathing. He's breathing too fast.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so with this cough has there has there been any sputum come up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yes yeah yellow sputum yeah

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any blood that you notice in the sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh and how was the fever checked?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We did, we did a rectal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and it has the temperature uh, Like has it, has there been a fever the entire time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We checked twice. We checked on the first day and then again last night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, and in regards to the difficulties breathing as there been any like changes to like is there been any noisy breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say he sounds slightly wheezy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been hearing any like whistling sounds when, when he's breathing in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I wouldn't say whistling no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And has he been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no. He actually. He hasn't gone through as many wet diapers as he normally does.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um has he been like, well, how's this appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um not the greatest, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so not not eating, eating as much or drinking as much?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How has his behaviour been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He's been very, very fussy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and inconsolable, would you say yes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, And any bowel problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that we noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, uh, have you guys been around any anybody who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so everybody else has been and been well, alright. Any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We haven't traveled recently, um. My mom, so his grandma had traveled recently and he saw her last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Where did she go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mexico.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how is Grandma doing now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She's doing fine, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, uh. And he saw her, he spent some time with her?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmhm, he spent the day with her.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. And I. So in regards to a past health. Has he had any symptoms or like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I guess last month he kinda had similar symptoms and they said it was a viral infection so he was just given some puffers to help his breathing and he got better on his own.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did they tell you what the diagnosis was at that time, or just say that it was a viral infection?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, they they said it could be bronchiolitis or just an upper viral infection.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any reasons for hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: At that time that he had the bronchiolitis or viral infection, he was hospitalized for two days just to help his breathing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and. Any any medications that he takes regularly or uses regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh he, no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any allergies to medications that you're aware of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and in regards to birth and prenatal history. Were there any complications throughout pregnancy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I wouldn't say so, no, It was normal. Everything was normal and he was a healthy baby.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And has Mom had any complications with any prior pregnancies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's he's the first one. He is the first one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, uh, was mom well throughout the pregnancy, like no infectious symptoms during?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any concerns with his growth or development so far?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then any concerns with either his vision or or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so if you um. OK, And And are his immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yes they are.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, could you tell me a little bit about the living situation, uh who's in the home currently and where you guys are living?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so we live in a house, it's him, myself, and my husband his dad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any pets at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No pets, No. Just, well actually a goldfish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh cool. And are there any concerns for like verbal abuse in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any physical abuse in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and does anybody smoke cigarettes in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then how about drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmm, we have like a glass of wine once a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and who's the primary caregiver for him?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I guess we both are. Yeah, we both are.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And um in the family, are there any lung conditions like asthma or any heart conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, my sister. So his aunt has asthma.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and Um. Does anybody, um is there any congenital diseases that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, How about any genetic diseases?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And. So um it's sounding like, I wanted to do a work up for His symptoms right now for breathing heavily and with the fever that's concerning for a type of infection and with being under three months it would warrant some investigations. So we'd want to check, do some blood tests. Yeah, and check his cerebrospinal fluid as well to make sure that there's no infection um in the brain I guess and what kind of go go from there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, yeah, that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um in the meantime, yeah, we'll give him some inhalers and keep the oxygen on to help with the lungs and breathing and then keep monitoring for how he's doing symptomatically.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You're welcome. Were there any, was there anything else that I I missed to ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, that sounds good. So if there was nothing else that you wanted to share, we will get that started and I I will be back shortly.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
